page.title: 20Things to see.Wishford area.
page.content: {Iron Age.}Grovely Castle,Ebsbury encampment.(Page 1,4). {Roman.}Earthworks,between Ebsbury and Wishford.(Page 1). {Norman.}Doorway with tympanum, St.Nicholas Church,Little Langford. Piers of green and grey stone and scalloped capitals,St.Mary's Church.Castle remains,Stapleford. Stapleford.Font in St.Giles'Church, Wishford. {14th C.}Bonham Tomb,St.Giles.Windows and S.transept,St.Mary's.(Page 4). {17th C.}The Grobham Monument,St.Giles. {18th C.}Royal Arms of Queen Anne,fire engine,iron bound chest,St.Giles.(P.4) {19th C.}Breadstones in the churchyard wall,St.Giles.(Page 4). {Oak Apple Day,}29th May,Wishford.(P.7) Visitors should also try freshly baked bread,from the Wishford Bakery,ideal for the picnic on Ebsbury Hill.
